results.title: Journey into tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Victorian Railways and Fortune Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the duplication and electrification of the Gippsland line to Yallourn and Traralgon. Shows its effect on the communities that look to the railway to bring them better living, more goods and greater service, and to take their products swiftly to market.
results.description: The story of the duplication and electrification of the Gippsland line to Yallourn and Traralgon. Shows its effect on the communities that look to the railway to bring them better living, more goods and greater service, and to take their products swiftly to market.

results.title: Goodness - it's milk!
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture. Film Unit
results.brief_description:
This short film, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, promotes the dairy industry by proclaiming the benefits of drinking milk.

The film opens with some lovely footage of a couple exploring the Blue Dandenongs, including a milkbar with signs for ‘Peter’s Ice-Cream’, ‘Herald’, and ‘Four ‘n’ Twenty Pies’, where they order two tall glasses of milk.

The film then shows scenes of schoolchildren, a patient and nurse in a hospital and a domestic kitchen, while the narrator describes the health benefits of milk. The film finishes with footage of the dairy industry, from the farm to industrial pasteurising and bottling processes, and finally home delivery.

results.title: [Melbourne buildings]
results.brief_description: A compilation of short segments highlighting various Melbourne buildings. ‘Elizabeth Tower Motel’ showcasing the cantilever staircase; construction of the new ‘Allan’s Music’ building; a modern office building; Parliament House; St Vincent’s Hospital; demolition of a building on an unidentified site; footage of the intersection of Flinders and Swanston streets taken from Southbank showing the Federation Square site and surrounds before the Gas and Fuel towers were constructed and demolished; ornamental gates near St Paul’s Cathedral; ANZ Bank.

results.title: Hotham holiday
results.brief_description: Shows Mount Hotham, Victoria as a holiday getaway - the snow fields, ski-runs; the trip from Harrietville 12 miles away; people riding horses to reach the snowline; beautiful views and natural environment. Hotham Heights is the highest meteorological station in Australia. This film was made pre “chairlifts”.

results.title: Mary's Story
results.creator_credit: Mary Herbert and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description:
Mary tells of her personal experience living with cerebral palsy. She recounts being told she could never walk, but her parents, determined that she could, helped her achieve this milestone. Mary goes on to speak about the troubles she has faced later in life.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.

results.title: Quilts of Understanding
results.creator_credit: Jenene Egan and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description:
In this story, Jenene tells of her life-long passion for all things craft. Recounting one of her proudest moments, she speaks about some patches that she created for a collaborative quilt-making project, which was exhibited at her Uniting Church and throughout regional Victoria.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.

results.title: Generations of Hands
results.creator_credit: Jennette Moore and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description:
Jennette was born in Ballarat. In this digital story, she talks about her personal experience growing up as a deaf person. She recalls learning how to sign and memories with her little brother and parents. Jennette also tells of her children (one of whom was sadly still-born) and grandchildren.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.

results.title: The Next Chapter
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Craig Dawson
results.brief_description:
Craig Dawson shares his personal experience of being diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis, a disease that his grandmother also suffered from. Craig dedicates this story to her.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.

results.title: The Sound of a Meringue Being Tortured
results.creator_credit: Antony Riddell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. A stop-motion animated short film where the characters repeatedly ask ‘Are you alright, mate?’.

results.title: Hopes and Dreams
results.creator_credit: Alex Litsoudis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Alex tells of a horrifying abuse he suffered in his childhood that resulted in permanent effects on his life. Following his passion for drama, Alex co-founded the ‘Ability Bunch’.
